decision_conditions: <p><span id="docs-internal-guid-124054d4-7fff-44ba-2f97-22aa883d629e"><span style="font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; font-variant-alternates: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;">The proposed development is located within a critical drainage area, and in the absence of flooding and drainage information submitted with this application, the proposed development fails to demonstrate that the flood risk in relation to the building is acceptable; contrary to part MA.2(2)(c) of Class MA, Part 3, Schedule 2 of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (as amended). </span></span><br></p>

<p>The proposed development, in the absence of a legal agreement to secure car-free housing would fail to promote the use of sustainable modes of transport and contribute to air pollution and congestion in the surrounding area,&nbsp;contrary to part MA,.2(2)(a) of Class MA, Part 3, Schedule 2 of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (as amended).&nbsp;<br></p>

<p>The proposed change of use is contrary to Class MA as the proposed development would result in the enlargement of an existing residential unit; and is contrary to Class MA of Part 3 of Schedule 2 of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (as amended) which seeks to create new self-contained residential units.&nbsp;<br></p>
description: Prior approval for the change of use from Commercial (Use Class E) to residential use (Use Class C3) .
